content:
TITLE: Creating Payment with Mollie API
DESCRIPTION: Example of creating a new payment using the Mollie client with amount, description, and redirect URLs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const payment = await mollieClient.payments.create({
  amount: {
    value:    '10.00',
    currency: 'EUR'
  },
  description: 'My first API payment',
  redirectUrl: 'https://yourwebshop.example.org/order/123456',
  webhookUrl:  'https://yourwebshop.example.org/webhook'
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Mollie Client
DESCRIPTION: Examples of creating a Mollie client instance using both ES modules and CommonJS syntax with an API key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import createMollieClient from '@mollie/api-client';

const mollieClient = createMollieClient({ apiKey: 'test_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM' });
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const { createMollieClient } = require('@mollie/api-client');

const mollieClient = createMollieClient({ apiKey: 'test_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM' });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Implementing Pagination with Mollie API
DESCRIPTION: Examples of implementing pagination using both page-based and iteration-based approaches for retrieving payments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const payments = mollieClient.payments.page({ limit: 15 });

const payments = mollieClient.payments.page({ limit: 15, from: 'tr_8WhJKGmgBy' });
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
for await (const payment of mollieClient.payments.iterate()) {
  // (Use break to end the loop prematurely.)
}
```

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const payments = mollieClient.payments.iterate()
  .filter(({ amount }) => amount.currency == 'EUR' && parseFloat(amount.value) > 100)
  .take(10);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Checking Payment Status
DESCRIPTION: Example of retrieving payment status using the payment ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const payment = await mollieClient.payments.get('tr_8WhJKGmgBy');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Mollie API Client using Package Managers
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the Mollie API client using npm or yarn package managers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm install @mollie/api-client
```

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn add @mollie/api-client
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Recurring Payment with Mollie API v2
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a recurring payment using the Mollie API v2, demonstrating the use of sequenceType instead of recurringType.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
mollie.customers_payments
  .create({
    amount: { value: '0.01', currency: 'EUR' },
    description: 'A first payment for recurring',
    redirectUrl: `https://example.org/redirect`,
    webhookUrl: `http://example.org/webhook`,
    sequenceType: 'first',
    customerId: 'cst_2mVdVmuVq2',
  });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Cursor-based Pagination in Mollie API v2
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use cursor-based pagination when retrieving a list of payments in Mollie API v2, specifying a limit and starting point.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
mollie.payments
  .all({
    limit: 15,
    from: 'tr_8WhJKGmgBy'
  })
  .then((payments) => {
    // Returns the list of 15 payments, starting with payment `tr_8WhJKGmgBy`
  });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Amount Format in Payment Creation
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates the change in specifying amounts when creating payments, moving from a single value to an object with currency and value properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
mollie.payments.create({
-  amount: 10.00
+  amount: {
+    "currency": "EUR",
+    "value": "10.00"
+  }
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Customer Payments Retrieval in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code shows the transition from using withParent to passing customerId as a parameter when retrieving customer payments, also demonstrating the shift to using Promises.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
mollie.customers.all()
  .then(customers => (
    customers.forEach(customer =>
      mollie.customers_payments.all({
        customerId: customer.id,
      })
        .then(payments => console.log(payments))
        .catch(err => console.error(err))
    )
  ))
  .catch(err => console.error(err));
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Removing withParent and Using Parameters in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates the removal of the withParent method and the new approach of passing parameters directly to the iterate method. It also shows the usage of async/await with the new API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- const payments = mollieClient.customerPayments.withParent(customer).iterate();
+ const payments = mollieClient.customerPayments.iterate({ customerId: customer.id });
  for await (const payment of payments) {
    â€¦
  }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Mollie Client with ES Modules
DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to initialize the Mollie client using ES Modules syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import createMollieClient from '@mollie/api-client';

const mollieClient = createMollieClient({
  apiKey: 'test_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM',
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Client Initialization from v1 to v2
DESCRIPTION: This code shows the changes in initializing the Mollie client when migrating from v1 to v2, moving from a class-based approach to a factory function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
-var Mollie = require('mollie-api-node');
-var mollie = new Mollie.API.Client;
-mollie.setApiKey("test_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM");
+const mollie = require('@mollie/api-client')({
+  apiKey: 'test_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM',
+});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Client Initialization in CommonJS
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates the change in initializing the Mollie client using CommonJS, introducing a named export createMollieClient.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- const mollieClient = require('@mollie/api-client')({
+ const mollieClient = require('@mollie/api-client').createMollieClient({
    apiKey: 'test_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM',
  })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Alternative Client Initialization in CommonJS
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows an alternative way to initialize the Mollie client using CommonJS, destructuring the createMollieClient function.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- const mollieClient = require('@mollie/api-client')({
+ const { createMollieClient } = require('@mollie/api-client');
+
+ const mollieClient = createMollieClient({
    apiKey: 'test_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM',
  });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Enums with Mollie Client in CommonJS
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use enums (like PaymentMethod) with the Mollie client in CommonJS, showcasing the new import structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const { createMollieClient, PaymentMethod } = require('@mollie/api-client');

const mollieClient = createMollieClient({
  apiKey: 'test_dHar4XY7LxsDOtmnkVtjNVWXLSlXsM',
});

mollieClient.payments.create({
  amount: {
    currency: 'EUR',
    value: '10.00',
  },
  description: 'Order #478',
  method: PaymentMethod.ideal
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Replacing Snake Case Properties with Camel Case in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code shows the migration from snake case properties to camel case properties when accessing Mollie API endpoints. It specifically demonstrates the change for customer subscriptions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- mollieClient.customers_subscriptions.get('sub_PCN3U3U27K', { customerId: 'cst_pzhEvnttJ2' })
+ mollieClient.customerSubscriptions.get('sub_PCN3U3U27K', { customerId: 'cst_pzhEvnttJ2' });
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Replacing Helper Functions with Direct Property Checks in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: These snippets show the removal of helper functions like isOpen() and hasSequenceTypeFirst(), replacing them with direct property checks against enum values.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- if (payment.isOpen()) {
+ if (payment.status == PaymentStatus.open) {
```

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- if (payment.hasSequenceTypeFirst()) {
+ if (payment.sequenceType == SequenceType.first)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Callback Signature in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the change in callback signature when migrating from v1 to v2 of the Mollie API client, separating error and response parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
-(response) => {
-  if (response.error) {
-    throw response.error;
+(error, response) => {
+  if (error) {
+    throw error;
  }
  return response;
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Endpoint Method Names in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates the changes in endpoint method names, specifically replacing 'list' with 'page' for the subscriptions endpoint.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- mollieClient.subscriptions.list({ limit: 10 })
+ mollieClient.subscriptions.page({ limit: 10 })
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Updating Error Handling in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates the change in accessing error properties, replacing getter methods with direct property access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
  try {
    const payment = await mollieClient.payments.get(â€¦);
  } catch (error) {
-   console.warn(error.getMessage())
+   console.warn(error.message)
  }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Replacing Count with Length for Pagination in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the replacement of the count property with length when working with paginated results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mollie/mollie-api-node/blob/master/MIGRATION.md#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: diff
CODE:
```
- mollieClient.payments.page({ limit: 10 }).count
+ mollieClient.payments.page({ limit: 10 }).length
```
